page.title: 03AILSWORTH AND WATERNEWTON
page.content: The largest village in the area is {Ailsworth}which is situated along the busy A47 road. It is joined to its neighbouring village, Castor. The number of dwellings in Ailsworth is well over one hundred and includes many styles and sizes of buildings. Some houses are owned by the local authority, but much of it is privately owned and quite expensive. In recent years the village has expanded with the growth of nearby Peterborough. As its name suggests{Waternewton}is located close to water, on the banks of the River Nene. The village itself is very small, with few facilities, the total number of dwellings being less than thirty. A focal point of the village is the old watermill, presently being restored. Beside the village is a lock on the River Nene which is well used by river traffic.
